meanings.definition: (of the heart) beat rapidly, strongly, or irregularly
meanings.sent1: My heart started to palpitate when I saw the scary movie.
meanings.sent2: Her heart began to palpitate with excitement as she waited for the results.
meanings.sent3: The little bunny's heart would palpitate every time it heard a loud noise.
meanings.sent4: The drums in the distance seemed to palpitate with the rhythm of the music.
meanings.sent5: The thunder made the ground palpitate beneath our feet.

meanings.definition: (of a person) experience a rapid or strong heart beat
meanings.sent1: I could feel my chest palpitate with nervousness before the big presentation.
meanings.sent2: She would palpitate every time she saw her crush walk by.
meanings.sent3: The thought of spiders made him palpitate with fear.
meanings.sent4: The anticipation of the roller coaster ride made her heart palpitate with excitement.
meanings.sent5: The unexpected news made his heart palpitate with shock.

meanings.definition: (of an object) move with a slight trembling motion
meanings.sent1: The leaves on the tree would palpitate in the gentle breeze.
meanings.sent2: The water in the glass seemed to palpitate as the train passed by.
meanings.sent3: The candle flame would palpitate whenever someone walked by it.
meanings.sent4: The flag on the pole would palpitate in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The butterfly's wings would palpitate as it rested on the flower.
